translation: Good evening, my friends!
transcript: 各位朋友，大家晚上好！

translation: Today, I want to talk about why we shouldn't oppose Genetic Modification technology.
transcript: 今天我们要来聊一聊，嘶为什么不应该反转基因技术。

translation: This is a popular topic.
transcript: 那么这个话题的话，是一个非常热门儿的话题。

translation: Before I deliver my speech.
transcript: 在这个之前的话。

translation: Let's make a small choice together.
transcript: 请大家配合我，我们一起来做一个小小的选择。

translation: So suppose you're given two kinds of food.
transcript: 那么我们现在有两种不同的食物。

translation: The genetically modified food, and the biotech food.
transcript: 一个是转基因的食物，一个是生物技术的食物或者食品。

translation: Put up your hand if you're willing to choose the genetically modified food.
transcript: 好，请愿意选择转基因食品的朋友举下手。

translation: Well, it seems few people put up their hands.
transcript: 好了，好像没看见几个手。

translation: And put up your hand if you're willing to select the biotech food.
transcript: 好，请我们愿意选择生物技术食品的朋友举下手。

translation: Ok, I see more hands this time.
transcript: 好，我看见了一些手，好吧。

translation: The truth is the genetically modified food and biotech food are the same food.
transcript: 实际上，转基因食品和生物技术食品它们都是一样的食品。

translation: And they are made by using the same technology.
transcript: 都是用同样的技术做出来的食品。

translation: So my friends.
transcript: 所以同这个朋友们。

translation: We can't blindly oppose the genetically modified technology.
transcript: 我们千万不能够盲目地来反对转基因。

translation: Well, there was a time when some people thought that the GM food was an American conspiracy against Chinese people and that whoever consumed it would gradually become infertile and  Chinese would die out in the end.
transcript: 那么曾几何时有些人认为，转基因食品是美国人做出来的一个阴谋，吃了转基因食品以后，那么他就会逐渐地就会失去生育的能力，那么中国人逐渐逐渐就会被灭绝，就没有啦。

translation: This is a conspiracy theory.
transcript: 这是一个阴谋论。

translation: But is this a real conspiracy?
transcript: 那么在这样一个状况下的话，大家想想可不可是那样？

translation: In fact, in the United States, ordinary people all eat the GM food.
transcript: 实际上在美国在美国这样一个国家，对吧，他们的老百姓都吃转基因的。

translation: Why?
transcript: 为什么？

translation: In the US, there are more than 2,000 different GM foods in the market, and the foods don't have to carry a GM label.
transcript: 因为市场上有两千多种不同的转基因食品，而且在美国是没有强制性的标识，就是不用写出来这是转基因，啊。

translation: This is to say, they do not know these are the GM foods.
transcript: 所以说的话，老百姓不知道的。

translation: In my opinion.
transcript: 所以我想。

translation: Americans must have been the first to taste the GM food as the US is the first to produce such food, right?
transcript: 美国人应该是最先食用转基因的一群人，因为美国是最先制造出转基因来的，对吧。

translation: If so, will Americans lose fertility eventually?
transcript: 所以那么如果是那样的话，美国人是不是也会没有了生育能力呢？

translation: Obviously, this is not the case.
transcript: 显然不是那样。

translation: Driven by the conspiracy theory, a campaign against the GM food was launched in China, with the aim of protecting the Chinese people, or "the descendants of the dragon".
transcript: 因为曾经有人说过，为了反对这个美国人把转基因食品拿来灭中国的“龙种”，因为我们是“龙的传人”，对吧，因此要要保“龙种”，掀起这么一个运动，对吧。

translation: On the contrary.
transcript: 恰恰相反。

translation: This January, the United States allowed the sales of the insect-resistant genetically modified rice, or the IRGM rice that is quite unpopular in China.
transcript: 那么在就是在今年的1月份，美国通过了中国在中国不受待见的转基因抗虫水稻。

translation: What does that mean?
transcript: 意味着什么呢？

translation: This means that the IRGM rice can be eaten and sold in the United States.
transcript: 这就意味着，中国的转基因抗虫水稻可以从此在美国进行食用，进行销售。

translation: And this renders the so-called conspiracy theory groundless.
transcript: 所谓的阴谋论就被这个不攻自破。

translation: You see, Americans themselves introduce and consume the IRGM rice.
transcript: 啊，因为美国人自己还引进了中国的转基因水稻来进行食用，对吧。

translation: So the conspiracy theory and campaign appear quite ridiculous now, right?
transcript: 所以说的话，这个事情现在想起来非常的荒唐和可笑，对吧。

translation: Why is that?
transcript: 为什么呢？

translation: I'll show you an example.
transcript: 好我们用用个例子来说明。

translation: I believe all of us in this studio like high-speed train, right?
transcript: 我想我们在座的观众不会有不喜欢高铁的，对吧。

translation: High-speed train is the pride of China.
transcript: 高铁是中国的骄傲。

translation: I think all of us are willing to have a long-distance trip by high-speed train and we are all happy to enjoy the speed, convenience and comfort it brings.
transcript: 没有人出远门儿不愿意乘坐高铁，没有人不为享受高铁的快捷、方便和舒适感到高兴，对吧。

translation: But do you know there was a similar movement against the train more than 100 years ago when it was first introduced in China?
transcript: 但是大家知不知道在一百多年前，当火车刚刚进入到中国的时候，那么同样的。

translation: As you can see from the picture here.
transcript: 大家看看这边有一张图，对吧。

translation: A group of people were talking about the devastating effects of the train on the "dragon vein".
transcript: 有一帮人就讲，火车破坏了中国的“龙脉”，对吧。

translation: Then the movement was launched to "destroy the rail and protect the dragon vein".
transcript: 于是的话，掀起了一个“扒铁路，保龙脉”的这样一个运动，对吧。

translation: As we see it now, the movement is quite ridiculous.
transcript: 那么今天我们来想想“扒铁路，保龙脉”是多么的可笑。

translation: Maybe after another 20 years.
transcript: 也许再过二十年。

translation: we will find our protest against the GM ridiculous, too.
transcript: 我们现在“反转基因，保龙种”也是同样的可笑。

translation: From my perspective.
transcript: 所以，我想。

translation: We shouldn't launch the ridiculous campaign against the GM food.
transcript: 我们不应该做这样的一个可笑的事情。

translation: Then you may ask what exactly genetic modification is.
transcript: 但是可能我们再想想，那什么叫做转基因，对吧。

translation: Well, first I want to introduce the concept of the gene.
transcript: 首先的话我想介绍一个概念，什么叫基因？

translation: Simply speaking, a gene is a sequence of ribonucleic acid with a genetic function.
transcript: 基因它就是具有遗传功能的一段核糖核酸的这么一个片段，对吧，这是最简单的解释。

translation: So what is genetic modification?
transcript: 那么什么叫做转基因呢？

translation: What is it?
transcript: 什么叫做转基因呢？

translation: In fact.
transcript: 其实转基因的话。

translation: We can see it both as a technology and a process.
transcript: 我们可以把它理解成一种技术，也可以把它理解成一个过程。

translation: To put it simply.
transcript: 因此的话，我们说得简单一点啊。

translation: genetic modification is a technology that transfers the genes from one species to another.
transcript: 就是说将一个物种中的基因转移到另外一个物种中去的这样一个技术，我们就把它称之为“转基因”。

translation: In other words.
transcript: 或者是说。

translation: It is a process through which the genes of one species are transferred to another species through some media.
transcript: 一个物种中的基因，诶它通过一定媒介转移到了另外一个物种啊。

translation: That's why we say it is both a process and a technology.
transcript: 这也是转基因的过程，是吧，所以说一个是过程，一个是技术。

translation: So we have to think about what it is that we oppose.
transcript: 所以说我们想想。

translation: The process or the technology, right?
transcript: 我们反对过程，还是反对技术，对吧？

translation: Well, of course, a gene is modified through some media, or as we can say, by natural hybridization.
transcript: 那么当然，转基因它需要一定的媒介，我们说可以进通过天然的杂交，是吧，来进行转基因。

translation: In fact, human beings have noticed natural hybridization produces a lot of new varieties.
transcript: 那么实际上人类看到这个天然产生的杂交，产生了很多新的一些东西。

translation: And we have also learned to conduct artificial hybridization.
transcript: 人类也学会了进行人工的杂交，是吧。

translation: Now, we can achieve genetic modification with biotech.
transcript: 那么现在的话我们用的现代的生物技术也可以转基因。

translation: So the process of modifying the genes becomes increasingly advanced.
transcript: 所以说这种转基因的过程是越来越这个高超，对吧。

translation: This is a technical point of view.
transcript: 所以这个是我们从技术这个角度来考虑。

translation: We can also consider it from the perspective of process.
transcript: 那么其实我们也可以从过程来考虑。

translation: The genetically modified process can actually occur between different individuals of the same species.
transcript: 那么这样一个转基因的过程，其实它可以发生在同一个物种的不同个体之间。

translation: But it can also occur between individuals of different species.
transcript: 但是它也可以发生在不同物种的个体之间，是吧。

translation: In fact, it is a process of transferring genes, and this requires a medium.
transcript: 那么实际上转基因它就是一个基因转移的过程，当然转基因它是需要一种媒介，对吧。

translation: Well, I am quite passionate about photography and taking photos.
transcript: 那么因为我是一个这个摄影发烧友，对吧，特别喜欢拍照。

translation: So I often venture out in order to discover how different insects serve as a medium to transfer genes between different species or between different flowers.
transcript: 那么我经常到大自然我去看，哎，有哪一些不同的昆虫，对吧，它们来进行这个媒介，作为一个媒介，在不同的物种或者在不同的花朵之间来进行转基因。

translation: This is the natural genetic modification.
transcript: 所以这就是天然转基因的状况，是吧。

translation: The following picture is also an example of natural genetic modification.
transcript: 那么现在大家可以看下面有张图，这也是老天爷在进行这个转基因的一件事儿。

translation: For example.
transcript: 比如说。

translation: We plant purple corns here, beside which white corns are planted.
transcript: 我们有一个紫色的玉米棒子的这种玉米，旁边还种着一排白色玉米棒子的玉米，对吧。

translation: If the wind blows the pollen of the purple corn to the white corn.
transcript: 大家想想如果是这个紫色的玉米的花粉随风飘荡，飘到这个白色的玉米上面。

translation: What color will the new variety bear?
transcript: 它们会结出什么颜色的玉米棒子？

translation: Just think about it.
transcript: 想一想。

translation: Ok, black and white, purple and white, the answers are quite reasonable.
transcript: 好，黑白、紫白啊，大家讲得很好。

translation: As we can see.
transcript: 那么大家看看啊。

translation: It produces a variety of this color.
transcript: 它就产生了这样的玉米棒子。

translation: Apparently, it is different from the white one, and it becomes much more colorful, right?
transcript: 显然就它跟它以前是不一样的，而且它的变化是更丰富，对吧。

translation: So GM is a process of creative mutation.
transcript: 所以说转基因过程，它是一个创造变异，对吧。

translation: Which gives our breeders more choices.
transcript: 让我们的育种家有更多的选择的这样一个机会。

translation: This is what we call the natural genetic modification.
transcript: 所以这就是我们讲的这个天然的转基因。

translation: In fact, breeders try hard to obtain more such genetic variation.
transcript: 那么实际上育种家为了获得更多的这样的遗传变异。

translation: So that they can screen the best genes for cultivating and developing quality varieties.
transcript: 便于我们筛选那些最好的来进行培育，形成优良的品种。

translation: Such as improving its quality, its resistance to insects or diseases and other qualities.
transcript: 比如说改善它的品质，改善它的抗虫性，改善它的抗病性等等，啊。

translation: Actually, we can also achieve mutations with radiation.
transcript: 那么实际上在这个变异的过程中，我们还可以用射线，是吧，来进行变异。

translation: For example, this picture shows space breeding.
transcript: 比如说你看我们看见的这张图上，是吧，太空育种。

translation: In the process, the seeds are sent to space with the rocket and after the cosmic radiation, they undergo mutations.
transcript: 把我们的种子搭载到火箭上，送到太空中去，让射线来射，然后它产生突变，这个可以产生变异。

translation: Mutation can also be achieved through the so-called cell hybridization by integrating different cells.
transcript: 而且我们也可以把不同的细胞，把它融合到一起，是吧，让它们产生所所谓的细胞杂交，也可以产生变异。

translation: However, this kind of mutation is a random process so it takes a lot of time for a singel mutation to be done.
transcript: 但是这些变异的话，实际上这种过程，它都是随机的，是吧，这个比较长漫长时间才能完成的一项工作。

translation: The genetic modification we talk about today, or we have talked the most about, is actually achieved by biotech.
transcript: 那么我们今天所谈到的转基因，或者大众讨论得最多的转基因，实际上就是用生物技术的方法来进行转基因，对吧。

translation: With biotech.
transcript: 那么通过这样的技术的话。

translation: we can cultivate genetically modified papaya and cotton.
transcript: 我们可以培育出转基因的木瓜，是吧，还有转基因的棉花。

translation: So let's take a look at how the genes are modified.
transcript: 那么实际上我们一起来看一看，这个转基因的过程它是怎么的。

translation: As we just mentioned, there is natural hybridization, but it is quite random.
transcript: 刚才我们已讲到了，老天爷它是进行杂交，那么现在就是说老天爷它太盲目了。

translation: Artificial hybridization may also be random.
transcript: 或者人工杂交也比较盲目。

translation: So what if we want it to precisely target and transfer the genes we want?
transcript: 那么如果是我们要让它非常定点地精确地来转我们想要的基因，我们怎么做呢？

translation: Well, first we have to find a "car", or a carrier called plasmid.
transcript: 那么我们首先要找一个“车子”，是吧，就像这个我们叫质粒，是吧。

translation: We have a small cut in the plasmid, and we can put the targeted gene in it.
transcript: 那么这个质粒的话，你可以把它切开一个小口子，是吧，然后把我们需要的那一个片段，把它黏到这个质粒上面来。

translation: Then, the plasmid serves as a taxi and takes the gene to a bacterium.
transcript: 质粒相当我们的一个出租车一样，我坐上出租车，对吧，然后再放到一个菌里面去，啊。

translation: Then it multiplies from one to numerous copies.
transcript: 那么它可以繁殖，从一份可以繁殖到很多份。

translation: So that it can interact with the cells whose genes we need to transfer.
transcript: 那么这样的话它就可以去跟那个我们需要转移的转基因的细胞进行接触，对吧。

translation: In this process, we can find out that the gene on the plasmid can flow to the cell, and can even squeeze into the nucleus to integrate itself with the chromosome of the cell.
transcript: 那么在这个过程中大家可以看到，那个质粒上的那个基因啊，它就可以释放到细胞中来，而且那个基因的话它可以钻到细细胞核里面去，和我们的细胞这个染色体里面的染色体进行融合，对吧。

translation: Finally, a different white callus is cultivated.
transcript: 培育成不同的这个白色的愈伤组织，对吧。

translation: Then the callus is cultivated to grow into a seedling and then a seed.
transcript: 然后这个愈伤组织呢再经过培养它就长成了小苗，对吧，这个小苗再进行培养就长成了大的苗。

translation: This way, the seed contains genetically modified genes and thus we develop a genetically modified plant.
transcript: 所以这样的苗里面它就含有了转基因，于是我们就做成了一个转基因植物，对吧。

translation: As we can see, this process is actually consistent with our traditional goal of passing on quality genes.
transcript: 所以你看看这个过程的话跟我们传统的目标是一致的。

translation: But it is faster, more accurate, and more efficient.
transcript: 但是它更快捷、更精准、更高效，啊。

translation: Then let’s discuss another question.
transcript: 那么我们来一起来看看。

translation: Why shouldn't we oppose genetic modification?
transcript: 为什么我们不应该反对转基因，啊。

translation: Well, we all know that it is a very tough task to ensure that people all over the world have enough food to eat.
transcript: 那么大家都知道，保证全世界的人民都有饭吃，这个是一个非常非常严峻的这样一个任务，是吧，人人都有饭吃而且吃饱饭。

translation: Let's look at the curves.
transcript: 那么大家看看这条曲线。

translation: The orange curve shows population growth trend.
transcript: 橙色的这条曲线是表示人口增长的一个趋势。

translation: And the blue dotted curve behind it shows the two possibilities for food production.
transcript: 而后面那个蓝色的虚线，是表明粮食的生产的两种可能性。

translation: If we adopt high technology and make good use of the land, the grain growth may follow the above curve.
transcript: 如果是我们利用高新的技术，对吧，很好地利用土地，那么粮食可能沿上面一条路线走。

translation: Which means food production can meet the needs of population growth.
transcript: 正好能够满足人的增增长的个需求。

translation: But if we don't adopt such technology.
transcript: 但是如果说我们不用这样的技术。

translation: We will encounter a huge gap in our food supply and such a gap will bring about many problems.
transcript: 可能我们粮食就会出现一个巨大的缺口，一旦出现缺口的话，那么实际上就会出现问题。

translation: Let's elaborate on it.
transcript: 那么中国字，大家想一想啊。

translation: The Chinese character 'Fan', or rice, consists of the left and right parts.
transcript: 中国字的“饭”，实际上是由两个部分构成。

translation: What's the left?
transcript: 一个部分叫什么？

translation: It's 'Shi', meaning food or to eat.
transcript: 叫“食”，对不对？

translation: And what's the right?
transcript: 另外一个部分是什么？

translation: It's 'Fan' or rebellion.
So taking the two parts together.
transcript: 粮食安全不能保证的话。

translation: We can see if we can't guarantee food security, social turmoil might occur.
transcript: 它就会造成这个社会的动乱，是吧。

translation: Population expansion poses a serious problem and it puts tremendous pressure on our food security.
transcript: 那么人口增长是一个非常非常大的问题，给我们的粮食保证带来了巨大的压力。

translation: What's exacerbating the situation is the process of urbanization.
transcript: 那么还有的话就是说城市化的这个过程。

translation: Because the infrastructure construction also takes up a lot of land.
transcript: 基础设施的修建的这个过程也占去了大量的土地，对吧。

translation: This photo was taken 30 years ago somewhere in Shanghai.
transcript: 大家看看这儿有一张照片，这个是三十年前在上海的某一个地方拍摄的。

translation: Well, can any of you recognize where it is?
transcript: 是吧，大家能够认出来这是什么地方吗？

translation: Well, a same set of photos were taken 20 years later almost in the same place.
transcript: 但是20年以后，几乎在同一个地方拍了同一组照片，我们来再来认认。

translation: Can you recognize it this time?
transcript: 有没有认识的？

translation: These are the photos.
transcript: 这个是20年后的照片。

translation: Can any of you recognize where it is?
transcript: 我们有没有认识的？

translation: Yes, it seems everyone knows it’s Pudong, isn’t it?
transcript: 看来大家都认识，是吧，就浦东嘛是吧，在浦东那一块儿，是不是？

translation: From the photos, we can see clearly that the former quality fields gave way to highways, or urban areas.
transcript: 所以说的话我们可以看到，以前的良田很多地方现在变成了公路，对吧，还有变成了城市。

translation: So urbanization takes up a lot of land.
transcript: 所以这个城市化的过程占去了很大的土地。

translation: China hopes to save 1.8 billion mu of such land.
transcript: 我们国家希望能够保住18亿的这样一个土地。

translation: But it has been a very difficult task so far.
transcript: 但是到目前为止非常非常的困难。

translation: In fact, we still face many problems.
transcript: 其实我们还面临着很多问题。

translation: Such as increasingly diminishing resources and the volatile global climate.
transcript: 比如说我们的资源不断地匮缺，是吧，我们的全球的气候的变化无常。

translation: For example, we may say Shanghai is surrounded by water but you may fail to realize that Shanghai is in a shortage of drinking water.
transcript: 你看我们像我们上海，上海你看我们周边有很多水，但是可能大家知不知道，上海是一个饮用水缺乏的地区，对吧。

translation: The scarcity of such resources brings about a lot of problems.
transcript: 所以这些资源的匮缺带来非常多的问题。

translation: What’s worse, we are still tasked with increasing the output of food to ensure that nobody would suffer from hunger.
transcript: 那么还有的话就是说，我们要想提高粮食的产量，保证每一个人都有饭吃。

translation: What should we do?
transcript: 那么怎么办呢？

translation: Can we try to expand the area of cultivated land?
transcript: 我们要提高产量的话，我们可不可以扩大耕地面积？

translation: It will definitely not work in China.
transcript: 在中国状况下肯定是不行的，行不通。

translation: So maybe we can spray more pesticides and use more fertilizers.
transcript: 那么我们这样做嘛，我们给它多喷点农药，是吧，多施点化肥。

translation: But do you really want to do this?
transcript: 你们愿意这样做吗？

translation: The food produced by the pesticides and fertilizers will eventually be eaten by you.
transcript: 到时候到你的碗里面去。

translation: So I believe you are definitely not willing to do so.
transcript: 你肯定不愿意做，对吧。

translation: This method can't be adopted in China either.
transcript: 所以这条路在中国也走不通。

translation: Because the ecological environment of our farmlands has already suffered from severe damage.
transcript: 因为已经农田农田生态环境已遭到很大的破坏，对吧。

translation: So the only option is to draw on the rich genetic resources, and combine them with our new biotechnology, including the genetically modified technology.
transcript: 那么我们唯一能够做的就是利用非常丰富的基因资源，再结合我们新的这个生物技术，包括我们的转基因技术。

translation: In this way, we produce more food in a speedy, accurate, and efficient manner.
transcript: 这样的话我们才能够以高速的、准确的、高效的这样一个状快，是吧，来生产出更多的这个粮食。

translation: As I mentioned earlier, each year 2 million tons of pesticides will be sprayed into the farmland in China.
transcript: 刚才讲到了，我们每年中国要向我们的农田里面喷洒200万吨农药。

translation: Just imagine what will the 2 million tons of pesticides cause?
transcript: 可以想想200万吨农药，对吧。

translation: But now we have an alternative technology at hand, that is the insect-resistant genetically modified rice or IRGM rice.
transcript: 但是现在我们可以用个替代的技术，我们也可以用转基因抗虫的水稻。

translation: Look at this picture, the IRGM rice grows well.
transcript: 你看大家看看这张图，对吧，就是转基因抗虫水稻绿幽幽的，对吧。

translation: Under the condition in which no pesticide is sprayed.
transcript: 和那个正常的不不抗虫的普通的水稻，对吧，

translation: There is a big difference between the IRGM rice and the ordinary rice which is not insect-resistant.
transcript: 在不施农药的状况下，你看它们之间的差异是非常非常大的，是吧。

translation: We can say that our traditional way aims to transfer a useful gene, like the white ball, to a better variety.
transcript: 所以说的话我们可以讲到就说，我们传统希望把一个有用的基因，像那个白色的球，对吧，把它转到一个比较好的品种里面去，传统的方法只是这样的目标。

translation: But it is a time-consuming and inaccurate process.
transcript: 但它耗时长，比较不准确。

translation: But the aim of transferring useful genes can also be realized by our current method.
transcript: 那么我们用现在的方法实际上也是达到同样的目的。

translation: Which is a more efficient and accurate approach, and even overcomes the reproductive barrier.
transcript: 但是你可以看到我们可以比较高效的、准确的而且还以扩这个跨越这个生殖障碍的这样一种方法，来达到转基因的目的，是吧。

translation: For example, the traditional approach of hybridization is quite helpless if we want to transfer the drought-resistant gene of the drought-resistant Populus euphratica to rice.
transcript: 比如说我们想把这个胡杨，这么抗旱的胡杨，它的抗旱基因转移到水稻，显然我们用杂交的方法是没法杂交的。

translation: But this transfer can be easily achieved with biotech and the GM technology.
transcript: 但是我们用生物技术我用转基因技术，我们轻易就可以达到这个目标，是吧。

translation: We can say that the GM technology is quite useful.
transcript: 所以说这个转基因它确实是一个非常好的这样一个技术。

translation: Some people may ask, despite all its merits, does the GM technology have any side effects?
transcript: 但是可能我们的朋友会会问呐，就说你把这个转基因说那么好，到底它有没有什么其它的问题呢，是吧？

translation: Well, as a new technology, the GM technology does have some problems.
transcript: 那么实际上转基因作为一个新的技术它确实它可能还存在着一些问题，对吧。

translation: Which should be solved through our efforts.
transcript: 那么这些都是我们要去解决的。

translation: Just as an old saying goes, "Food is the first and paramount necessity of people".
transcript: 首先存在的大家就觉得它我们叫“民以食为天”，对吧。

translation: The first public concern is whether the GM food is safe and whether it will have side effects such as causing illness.
transcript: 它会不会有粮食这个品这个食品安全的问题，对吧，吃了以后会不会产生问题，得病等等，是吧。

translation: And will it pose a threat to the environment?
transcript: 那么它还有对环境它会不会造成什么影响，对吧。

translation: Apart from the health and environment issues.
transcript: 那么除此之外的话。

translation: People may also worry about whether we should attach GM labels to the foods so that our right of knowing and choosing is defended.
transcript: 那么还有一些比如说我们应不应该给我们的转基因食品贴上标签，让老百姓有知情权和选择权，对吧。

translation: Other concerns may involve whether laws and regulations will be promulgated to regulate these things.
transcript: 那么还有就是说国家的法规法律会不会来做这些事情等等等等，这有很多的选择。

translation: In fact.
transcript: 实际上。

translation: China has laws and regulations in place for GM foods.
transcript: 在我们国家的话，是有非常完善的这个法规来管这件事情，是吧。

translation: Moreover, a GM product can be produced and commercialized only after it passes the stringent safety assessments in every stage from its development to its production.
transcript: 而且的话，就是说我们在转基因的任何一个转基因，它在进入到商品生产的这个过程中，它都必须严格地进行这个安全的评价，只有安全以后它才能够进行销售，才能进行商品化。

translation: For this reason.
transcript: 因此的话。

translation: International agencies believe that GM foods or products are safe.
transcript: 国际机构认为，是吧，转基因食品，转基因产品它是安全的。

translation: The UNFAO also believes that GM products are safe and legal.
transcript: 国际的联合国的粮农组织他们也认为，转基因产品是安全的，也是合法的。

translation: Because it is operated under the global framework of GM technology.
transcript: 因为它都是在全世界的转基因，它都是在这个框架下来进行的。

translation: Ok, We've just talked about the reasons for not opposing genetic modification.
transcript: 好，那么现在我们看看，刚才讲到了转基因，是吧，为什么不能反对转基因。

translation: So now I want to discuss why we Chinese should be the last to campaign against GM foods.
transcript: 那么现在讲作为中国人，我们为什么更不应该来反转基因，我们来一起来看看。

translation: GM technology has been used globally for nearly 20 years.
transcript: 那么全世界这个使用转基因已经，是吧，将近了20年。

translation: During this period.
transcript: 在这个过程中。

translation: Texpansion to 180 million hectares or roughly about 2.7 or 2.8 billion mu.
transcript: 转基因的这样一个种植的面积非常迅速地扩大，是吧，现在已经达到了1.8亿公顷，我计算了一下大概相当于27或者28亿亩这么一个面积。

translation: The above green line represents the overall cultivation area of GM foods.
transcript: 大家看看这条绿色的线，上面这条绿色的线话，表明是转基因的一个总体的种植面积。

translation: The blue line shows the cultivation area in developed countries.
transcript: 红蓝色的线的话是表明发达国家，是吧，种植的一个面积。

translation: And the red line refers to the developing countries.
transcript: 红色这条线是发展中国家。

translation: This shows that developing countries have exceeded developed countries in terms of the cultivation area.
transcript: 大家可以看一看，发展中国家已经超过了发达国家的这个种植面积。

translation: The whole world is increasing the cultivation area, but it's a different case in China.
transcript: 但是在这样一个全世界都向上地增长的这样一个状况下，我们中国的状况是。

translation: As you can see,  we ranked fourth in 2002, and then moved downwards to the fifth place, then to sixth, and to the eighth.
transcript: 你看从2002年我们排名第4，是吧，后来排名第5，再排名第6，现在我们已经排名到第8上去了，是吧、

translation: Actually, this rank is very inconsistent with the status of our country.
transcript: 所以说的话这个是跟我们国家的地位是非常不符的。

translation: Here is a set of data.
transcript: 这儿有一组数据大家可以来一起来看看。

translation: In 2001, China ranked fourth, following the United States, Canada, and Argentina.
transcript: 那么2001年的时候，中国排名第四，我们前面有美国、加拿大，对吧，阿根廷等。

translation: But after 2003, we were surpassed by Brazil, and in 2007, we ranked sixth, surpassed by India.
transcript: 但是到了2003年以后，对吧，巴西就超过我们了，那么再到了2007年的时候印度超过我们，于是我们排到第6名，啊。

translation: What a pity!
transcript: 非常可惜，啊。

translation: India used to be a cotton importer.
transcript: 那么印度以前是一个棉花的进口国。

translation: But the use of GM technology has transformed it into a cotton exporter.
transcript: 由于它引用这个技术，于是它已经成了一个棉花的出口国，是吧。

translation: As the statistics show, China has lagged far behind India.
transcript: 那么中国已经比它，大家看这个数字中国已经比它小很少很多了，是吧。

translation: For many years, China maintained the sixth place, and many small countries were trying to catch up.
transcript: 而且中国在第六位上维持了很多年，后面还有很多小国家都在追赶中国。

translation: Then in 2016, China slid to the eighth place, even surpassed by Paraguay and Pakistan.
transcript: 那么到了2016年的时候中国一下就排到第8名去了，连这个巴拉圭，是吧，巴拉圭，巴基斯坦都超过了我们，是吧。

translation: At first, I was wondering how come Paraguay could closely follow China in the rank for about 10 years.
transcript: 当初我在想巴拉圭是个什么样的国家紧紧地跟在中国后面，仅大概10年左右。

translation: Later, I found Paraguay was a very small country in South America, with a population of only 6 million.
transcript: 后来一查巴拉圭是这个南美一个非常小的国家，人口只有600多万，对吧。

translation: A country with a 1.4 billion population and a country with a 6 million population.
transcript: 一个14亿人口的国家和一个600万人口的国家。

translation: Considering the huge difference in population, the rank doesn't match our national image and our national status.
transcript: 它们之间的这样一个差异，这个形象是非常不符的，是吧，跟我们国家国家的地位，各方面都是不符的。

translation: This echoes a Chinese saying.
transcript: 因此的话我们讲。

translation: "In sailing against the current, we must keep forging ahead or we will keep falling behind".
transcript: 逆水行舟，不进则退，是吧。

translation: Apart from being a lucrative technology, genetic modification is also a technological high ground.
transcript: 因为转基因是一个赚钱的这样一种技术，转基因也是一个技术的高地。

translation: If we don't seize it, other countries will definitely occupy it.
transcript: 这个高地我们如果不去占领的话，其他国家肯定会去占领。

translation: When we are still arguing whether we should develop or adopt GM technology.
transcript: 当我们还在争论该不该发展、该不该使用的时候。

translation: Many countries have crept up and surpassed us.
transcript: 很多国家已经悄悄地超过了我们。

translation: I think this is a severe and worrying phenomenon.
transcript: 所以这个现象，我觉得是非常非常严峻的。

translation: And food security is also a very important issue.
transcript: 而且粮食安全也是非常重要的问题。

translation: China has to import 100 million tons of grain annually.
transcript: 我们国家现在每年要进口1亿吨粮食。

translation: It's 100 million tons of grain.
transcript: 1亿吨粮食。

translation: What does that mean?
transcript: 这是什么概念，是吧？

translation: It means that every Chinese has to import 70 kilograms of food on average.
transcript: 我计算了一下，每一个人，相对于中国中国人每一个人要进口70公斤粮食。

translation: What if the countries refuse to export to us one day?
transcript: 如果是哪一天人家不进口我们怎么办？

translation: Then this will cause a big problem, right?
transcript: 那么我们就会出现比较大的这样一个问题，对吧。

translation: So if we continue to refrain from developing GM technology.
transcript: 所以说如果是我们不发展。

translation: We will definitely lose a good opportunity.
transcript: 肯定就会丧失掉这样一个机遇，对吧。

translation: In fact, we had a glorious history of the production of GM foods.
transcript: 那么其实回想中国的转基因这个生产啊，那么曾经我们有过辉煌的时期。

translation: We made such success in our genetically modified cotton, which not only saved our cotton industry.
transcript: 中国的转基因棉花的成功，不光是拯救了中国的棉花的这个产业。

translation: But also showed a remarkable, eye-catching Chinese image to the whole world.
transcript: 而且让全世界这个感觉得非常了不起，瞩目，对吧。

translation: Before the production of genetically modified papaya, farmers could do nothing to combat the virus.
transcript: 那么想想过去，我们的转基因番木瓜还没有上市的时候，农民面对病毒的这个危害，没有办法，对吧。

translation: But today we could see their smile when they harvest the virus-resistant GM cotton.
transcript: 但是今天我们看见他们扛着抗病毒的转基因棉花喜获丰收的笑脸。

translation: It's at this moment that we feel the technology is so creative that it brings happiness to us.
transcript: 这个时候我们感觉到这个技术它是多么的有创造力，多么的有这个给我们带来幸福，是吧。

translation: I hope that our technology will make our life better.
transcript: 因此的话我想，希望让我们的技术，让我们的生活变得更美好。

translation: Thank you!
transcript: 好，谢谢大家！
